p: Fatty acids occur widely in nature, being identified in both animal tissue and plants. Particularly, short-chain saturated acids are components of milk fats: in bovine milk, butanoic acid along with other SCFA and MCFA have been reported [ 147]. Likewise, the MCFA lauric acid and myristic acid are the major components of the oils obtained from some Lauraceae and Myristiceae species [ 148]. Moreover, palmitic acid is the most representative SFA in vegetable oils, such as palm oil [ 149].
